name: Hilton Milwaukee City Center

reviews.text: I expected the Hilton in downtown Milwaukee to be very much like the old hotels I used to get stuck in when I had to travel to Chicago in the 1980's -- small dark rooms, odd smells, peeling wallpaper, etc. I was pleasantly surprised to find none of that.
reviews.title: Better than I Expected

reviews.text: True, the front desk clerks were bored and indifferent. But the room service was outstanding -- and that's really all I care about in terms of hotel personnel.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in the Heart of Milwaukee

reviews.text: My only complaint -- the paper-thin walls. In the mornings, I could hear the person in the next room blowing his nose. Not quite as bad as the hotel in Missouri where I could hear the person next door unroll his toilet paper -- but not great. At the Milwaukee Hilton I could hear every word the guy next door said over his cell phone. Every word.
reviews.title: Not so great

reviews.text: I was kind of disappointed that I had to pay for an internet connection. About $9 per day. I thought that made the Hilton noncompetitive with hotels who provide free internet. But that's minor. At least it worked.
reviews.title: Old and outdated

reviews.text: One thing I liked that was a surprise -- there's a parking lot right about 25 steps from the Hilton's front door. So you don't have to drive up and down parking garage ramps -- but there's a garage right next door anyway if you want to use it.
reviews.title: A fantastic hotel!

reviews.text: My friend and I had an enjoyable weekend stay at the Milwaukee City Center Hilton. We found it convenient to many locations and would have been able to walk to a great many places had it not been so cold! It's a short drive to the art museum (maybe a mile or so) or the famous German restaurants, such as Madar's (which was great) and the Water Street area. Again, I think you could walk to Water Street and the German restaurants if the weather was nicer! The hotel is connected to the convention center. In addition, it is a short drive to North Avenue, which has additional restaurant / nightlife selections. It's a max 10 minute drive to the Miller brewery tour.
reviews.title: Excellent Priceline Deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is dated, but everything was clean and the rooms were definitely spacious enough. Plenty of room to move around in the bathroom, plenty of space for the desk, etc. The Crabtree & Evelyn products at Hiltons are always a nice touch. I wouldn't pay $250 a night to stay there, but via Priceline I was able to stay for two nights for half that. Definitely a deal.
reviews.title: Hilton over the Holidays

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is Vegas-esque in that it has plenty of options and you don't need to leave. There is a Miller Brew Time pub, a family restaurant, and a steakhouse on the premises. The pub had adequate bar food. In addition, there is room service, which we did for breakfast, which was prompt and enjoyable. I did notice many families coming for the indoor water park that is part of the hotel complex. The concierge is extremely accommodating.
reviews.title: Strange man in our room
Hilton Milwaukee
reviews.text: The parking rate is $22 / day. In addition, it is approximately $25 to/from the Milwaukee airport by taxi.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all I enjoyed my stay and would stay at this hotel again! Milwaukee is a great, friendly city and I hope to be back!
reviews.title: Average, Average

reviews.text: First I have to agree with a previous review that said that they would stay again in this hotel but not for $150 a night. I ended up paying $125 a night because I had a coupon from Expedia and now I realize after staying there that I overpaid. $100 or less is what I feel one should pay for this hotel in this location.
reviews.title: Great Location, Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now having said that, the pros and cons of this hotel are as follows.
reviews.title: Nice but earplugs needed

reviews.text: Pros: location, location, location. I took the 80 bus from the airport (25 min bus ride, $2, can't beat that) and it left me right on the corner on 6th street and Wisconsin Ave. The 90 bus to Miller Park is right outside the hotel on Wisconsin Avenue (again, $4 r/t to the ballpark, can't beat that). There's a mall a block and a half down, the waterfront is a 10 min walk tops, Third Ward is also about a 5-8 min walk. Pretty much you can walk anywhere you want from this hotel and I felt pretty safe all weekend walking around.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Good Location

reviews.text: Service, despite what others wrote, I didn't have any problems with service. The young lady who handled my check in was fantastic and my room was serviced and everything replaced.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, kind of small room

likes.liked: — close to city center, friendly staff, clean room
likes.disliked: — room was small with no closet

reviews.text: The room is very nice and the bed is very comfortable and I didn't find the bathroom to be that small (maybe cause I'm used to bathrooms being that size in NYC).
reviews.title: Service that is a step behind

likes.disliked: — Service in general from housekeeping, front desk, wait staff in bar, and wait staff in cafe.

reviews.text: This Hilton is nice, but definatly needs some updating. The towels were very thin, and my first day there, I grabed my towel to dry my face, and it looked like it was used to wipe up some dirt and dust bunnies off of the floor, but yes was hung up for my use in the room. The people at the front desk were always very rude, and seemed like they did not want to help anyone. The Miller Time Pub was very nice, and the people there were very friendly. One of the girls that I was staying with was using the ATM in the Hilton, and was basicly assulted by someone off the street tring to get her money. Another person was confronted by the same person in the elevator ans was followed to their room, and had to get physical. When the hotel was told, their responce was, "Oh, is he back again?". I have had much better service, and felt safer at other hotels. You would think that your experience would be better for a Hilton. I would not recomend this hotel.
reviews.title: Hilton Milwaukee City Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed the Hilton. It's a beautiful hotel, despite a little wear and tear. The location was perfect, the view of the lake was magnificent and our room was very large.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

likes.disliked: — Some wear and tear in public areas

reviews.text: We had a casual dinner at the bar downstairs and would highly recommend their burgers. Absolutely perfect.
reviews.title: Old school hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here for 1 night and I really enjoyed it. My room was on the 15th floor and it had 2 double beds (they were out of kings). However, the room was large and spacious and the bedding was super plush. The bathroom had been updated and I found my room extremely clean. On the downside, the towels were a little thin and there was no vending machine on my floor. In fact, after a certain hour, you have to go all the way to the lobby for vending machines. I thought that the hallways needed a little updating but I have no complaints about the room itself. I would definitely stay here again and I prefer this HIlton to the other Hilton in Milwaukee. It had an old school charm that I loved.
reviews.title: Faded Glory

likes.disliked: — poor remodeling/refurbishing of building and rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an old building that has undergone a mediocre refurbishment (e.g. gold paint rather than gold leaf). Rooms are small, and windows do not open at all. Shower was decrepit, air conditioning was intermittent, ceilings were stained. I requested a change of room the second morning of my stay, and another room was not ready until 6pm. Staff was average, and not particularly helpful. Two restaurants on the property; an expensive steakhouse and a large good cafe with a very varied menu reasonably priced. Location is good, on the edge of the city. Rooms were not expensive. Honors members get a small buffet breakfast included.
reviews.title: Small but Decent

description: This elegant, historic hotel is a landmark in downtown Milwaukee. Recently renovated guest rooms and suites provide modern comforts. The hotel is connected by skywalk to the Wisconsin Center and is in the middle of thriving downtown shopping, eating and theater areas. All of Milwaukee's great attractions are minutes away including Miller Park, BMO Harris Bradley Center, Milwaukee Art Museum, Harley Davidson Museum and Discovery World.
